title: Tiny baby born weighing just one pound goes home after 150 days in hospital
text:
After 150 days at the hospital, baby Kallie Bender is finally set to go home. (Picture: WUSA9/Dignity Health)

A tiny baby born so prematurely she was shorter than a Barbie doll has finally gone home after 150 days in hospital.

Baby Kallie Bender was born more than three months premature on May 24 in Phoenix, Arizona.

She weighed just 0.8 pounds at birth, making her one of the smallest babies ever born in Arizona, according to Dr Vinit Manuel.

Dr Manuel said Kallie’s chance of survival was very low. But she spent five months gradually improving at St’s Joseph Hospital and Medical Center’s neonatal intensive care unit and is now set to be discharged to join the rest of her family.

‘Now she weighs more than seven pounds and is ready to go home today,’ Dr Manuel said, according to AZ Central.

‘Just to tell you briefly about babies who are born so small, there is something called a tiny baby registry and worldwide there are about 225 babies in that registry since 1936,’ Dr Manuel continued to say, adding that Kallie was on that list.

Kallie’s mom, Ebonie Bender, said she had an ultrasound appointment on May 20, which is where she learned she would need emergency surgery to save her daughter’s life.

Her pregnancy was considered high-risk because of her blood pressure. There was also a lack of fluid around the baby causing a condition called absent end diastolic flow.

Dr Manuel wrote in a press release: ‘Absent end diastolic flow occurs when the blood flow is reduced or reversed from the placenta to the unborn baby, preventing them from getting the nutrients they need.’

‘This condition can affect the baby’s growth in utero and impact their lung and gastro-intestinal development.’

Kallie’s father, Dameon, holds his daughter as nurse Becky Cole examines her. (Picture: Dignity Health)

Shortly after she was born, Kallie required a complex heart surgery to correct a defect known as patent ductus areriosus, which is common among extremely preterm infants.

It would be 37 days before Ebonie and Kallie’s father, Dameon Bender, held their baby.

Kallie has miraculously survived despite the odds against her and now will go home with her family.

Ebonie said: ‘I could not be more grateful for the doctors here, for our three primary nurses. Although she’s going home with oxygen and her feeding tube, she’s still doing an amazing job at fighting..’
description: Baby Kallie Bender was born more than three months premature on May 24 in Phoenix, Arizona and will return home after 150 days in hospital.
